newsitem.title: JAPAN: Fujitsu to set up ASEAN headquaters in Singapore.
newsitem.headline: Fujitsu to set up ASEAN headquaters in Singapore.

text.p: Fujitsu Ltd said on Monday that it has set up a wholly owned subsidiary in Singapore to manage operations in countries of the Association of South East Asian Nations.
The establishment of the new firm, Fujitsu Asia Pte Ltd, is aimed at strengthening ties among Fujitsu group companies in the region, the company said in a statement.
The new firm also plans to start outsourcing and network related services in the future.
In addition to Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines and Indonesia, the Fujitsu group will expand its reach to Brunei, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam and Burma, the statement said.
